summary: This is an email chain from October 2020 between federal prosecutors discussing the review of materials from Epstein-related search warrants. The primary topic is identifying potentially privileged communications, specifically those involving private investigators like Roy Black and attorney Jack Goldberger, and coordinating with the estate's attorneys.

persons.name: Roy Black
persons.context: Mentioned as a private investigator hired by Epstein in connection with criminal investigations and civil litigation in Florida. His communications are being reviewed for potential privilege claims.

persons.name: Marc Weinstein
persons.context: Identified as one of the attorneys representing the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Andrew Tomback
persons.context: Identified as one of the attorneys representing the co-executors of Jeffrey Epstein's estate.

persons.name: Darren Indyke
persons.context: Named as a co-executor of Jeffrey Epstein's estate, whose legal representatives are Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback.

persons.name: Jack Goldberger
persons.context: Identified as an attorney who represented Jeffrey Epstein. His email address was flagged for privilege review, and associated hits were moved out of the review database.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The central subject of the investigation. The emails discuss reviewing materials from search warrants related to him and coordinating with his estate's attorneys.

connections.description: Epstein hired private investigator Roy Black in connection with criminal investigations and civil litigation.
Jack Goldberger is identified as an attorney who represented Jeffrey Epstein.
Marc Weinstein is an attorney representing Darren Indyke, a co-executor of Epstein's estate.
Andrew Tomback is an attorney representing Darren Indyke, a co-executor of Epstein's estate.

events.title: Privilege Review Coordination
events.description: Federal prosecutors email to coordinate the review of Epstein search warrant materials, specifically flagging communications from private investigators and attorneys for potential privilege claims.

keyFacts: Federal prosecutors were actively reviewing a database of materials from Epstein-related search warrants as of October 2020.
The review specifically flagged communications involving private investigator Roy Black, who was hired by Epstein for Florida criminal and civil matters.
Attorney Jack Goldberger, who represented Epstein, was also flagged, and his associated emails were pulled from the review database.
The estate of Jeffrey Epstein was represented by attorneys Marc Weinstein and Andrew Tomback, acting for co-executor Darren Indyke.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal procedures to handle privilege claims post-Epstein's death.
